The Warden's Office nowadays shows that more peaceable tis a straight-backed rush chair before a long table. Atop the Warden's desk sit a pot of hot herb tea and a tray of Mithin's donuts.

node.name: Gallows Tree, Dungeon
node.description: Though now in disuse, in more turbulent times criminals and prisoners of war were brought here to confess to crimes, treason and heretical views, whether they were guilty or not. Notorious Elven inquisitors made use of such painful procedures as stretching limbs on the rack, burning flesh with live coals, squeezing fingers and toes or for those particularly stubborn cases the strappado, a vertical rack.

node.name: Eik Wood, Granite Outcroppings
node.description: Granite outcroppings scattered among the trees and brush sit like the abandoned toys of giants. The trail leads deeper into the forest and back up over a larger sloping granite monolith partially buried in the soil.

node.name: Kilth Aldiyaus, Atrium
node.description: You are within the main temple of Leth Deriel, devoted to all the gods and goddesses of Elanthia, for each to worship in his or her own way. This atrium is in the heart of an old banyan tree that constantly sends out new shoots. It is hollow all the way to the top, allowing the air and light to filter down through green leaves, more radiant than any stained-glass cathedral window could ever be.

node.name: Kilth Aldiyaus, Meditation Branch
node.description: Low benches, slanted to be knelt upon, are arranged in rows along the floor of the room. Devotees and layfolk of all races and professions sit side by side, silently immersed in meditative exercises. Along the walls are mats, and racks bearing wooden staves and swords, as well as ceremonial longbows.

node.name: Kilth Aldiyaus, Prayer Branch
node.description: Vaulted beams are carved into the grain of the wooden walls. Echoes of mumbled prayers and heartfelt supplications are amplified by the room's curvature. In the reverberating din, the names of all the deities mingle, then merge as one. A polished Sana'ati wood altar is surrounded by hooded figures kneeling on the bare floor.

node.name: Arthianna's Clinic, Healing Tent
node.description: Arthianna, the famed Elven empath, appears young but carries herself around the treatment tent with a grace and self-assurance that could only come from many years of experience, wisdom and practice in the healing arts. Under the barkcloth canopy, she methodically and compassionately moves from cot to cot, tending to the most seriously injured first, revitalizing patients with her touch.

node.name: Eshar's Trading Post, Backroom
node.description: There is very little room to move about in the backroom, except for a narrow aisle cleared from the door to a long counter in the rear. The rest of the floor is strewn with boxes, crates and cartons piled and stacked to make use of all available space. Locked cabinets and shelves cover every inch of wall space. At the counter stands Eshar's appraiser busily examining numerous items heaped in front of him.

node.name: Eshar's Trading Post, Main Room
node.note: Eshar's Trading Post|Trader Outpost|trade minister|shipment clerk
node.description: Eshar the pawnbroker casts you a surly glance as you enter the dusty, disheveled trading post. His attitude strikes you as odd, especially for someone dealing with those who come here to part regretfully with their valuables. It is even more puzzling because he is also a contact for many of the traders doing business in Leth Deriel. But recalling some of the traders you have met, perhaps his attitude is understandable. He is the younger brother of Ershem the papermaker.

node.name: Eshar's Trading Post, The Pit
node.description: A small, rounded room at the back of the trading post serves as its brokerage area. Now and again, a clerk or two consult with the pricing board located near the entrance, making updates or verifying the information they find. The clerk in charge of commodities nods at you in greeting as you enter, but otherwise seems disinterested in your company.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Sloping Path
node.description: This narrow dirt path appears to be in a constant twilight regardless of the actual time, forever shadowed by the dense forest to the west and Ankis Dir to the east. To the north lies Durmast Gate, adding both darkness and light on the way into Leth Deriel, while to the southwest, the trail skirts the foothills and descends around the edge of the forest.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Forest Edge
node.description: This path follows the forest down a tall grassy hill crowned by stone menhirs. A tiny stream trickles across the lower end of the trail, breaching the dense forest to the south and creating a possible route inwards. Ever vigilant, an Elven scout stands guard near the stream.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Dense Woods
node.description: A muddy streambed provides the only standing room inside this dense forest, crowded with spindly trees, brush and massive roots that push under, past, and in places even above the plant life which seems to inhabit every available inch. Fortunately, the path seems to open up towards the north.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Tunnel Below the Roots
node.description: It's pitch dark and you can't see a thing!
Massive silvery roots weave in and out, forming the walls of this cavern-like area under the foot of a huge tree. Slightly above and to the west, there is a fissure in the wall of the root cave.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Grove of the White Laurel
node.description: The dense forest has been pushed back here by the massive roots of a huge camphor laurel with a canopy that reaches almost forty yards high. Although not nearly as wide as the great Sana'ati Dyaus, the tree could very likely be just as old. Long branches stretch out in every direction over the root-ridden ground. One limb is low enough that it may be possible to climb it. It is far from serene here, for loud croaking sounds seem to be coming from all directions, including from above.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Grove of the White Laurel
node.description: A low thick branch stretches its dense canopy of leaves across the area, attempting to push back the advance of the wild forest surrounding the tree.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Grove of the White Laurel
node.description: A gnarled and twisted limb swoops down towards the ground as if reaching for the tiny spring that bubbles up from the brush to the west and trickles south. The branch has such deep lines that it almost looks as if it were made of small vines braided together over time.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Grove of the White Laurel
node.description: Vines wind up the southeast side of the tree, covering the bark in tiny white blossoms with very little fragrance. The flowers cover a high bough and drape down as if hanging from a trellis in a well-tended garden.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Grove of the White Laurel
node.description: The branches of the laurel are very high on the south side, but even here, ominous croaking threatens from above. Invasive vines and brush creep up from the dense forest around the tree, attempting to take the area the great laurel has long guarded. Only the presence of thick roots breaking the surface of the ground keeps the brush at bay enough for a traversable path to exist.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, Grove of the White Laurel
node.description: A V-shape in the branches has allowed daylight to reach the ground here, feeding a crop of bushes crowded around a tiny stream. Large red trumpet flowers blanket the sunny side of the intermingled bushes, filling the air with their sweet scent. The branches of the camphor laurel are out of reach, although it is plain to see an easier ascent to the north.
Long dark stalks invade a patch of ground under the tree. The bulbous flowers have pulled in their petals, reminding one of tiny gem pouches drawn closed for protection from the shadows of the night.

node.name: In the White Laurel, A Sturdy Limb
node.description: The laurel's thick canopy provides a lush home for treehopper toads. Despite the constant croaking noise coming from all directions, this area seems subdued compared to the ground below.

node.name: In the White Laurel, A Gnarled Limb
node.description: Deep hills and valleys permeate the wood, making it easy to imagine shapes within the textured bark. A pair of knots in the main trunk looks out at the scenery like unblinking eyes. The gnarled limb slopes downward to the northwest, making it easy to get down from here.

node.name: In the White Laurel, A Thick Branch
node.description: This long branch stretches east, pushing back the brush and trees and demanding its full share of sunlight. It is fairly low to the ground, making it easy to jump down from here.

node.name: In the White Laurel, A Twisted Branch
node.description: Jutting out of the main trunk at a curious angle, this twisted branch seems to right itself as it ascends out of the mesh of other limbs and boughs until it pushes out southwest over thick brush. Daylight streams down on a small patch of ground, unhindered because of the curious change in direction. The drop from here would be precarious at best, but with a little work one might still be able to get down by scaling the trunk of the laurel.

node.name: In the White Laurel, A Thin Bough
node.description: This precarious perch offers a good view of the top of the White Laurel and the impressive forest which it inhabits. To the north is Leth Deriel, and the great Sana'ati reminds one of a great umbrella stretching out over the crowns of the other trees.

node.name: In the White Laurel, A Knotted Bough
node.description: Vines filled with tiny flowers drape across the tertiary branches of the knotted bough, forming a cradle of snowy white petals that drape down towards the ground below.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Caravan Stables
node.description: Once an outbuilding for storing casks of wine, yaks and mules now quietly nuzzle hay ricks seeking their dinner. Slim Elven youths work amongst the stalls, raking out old bedding and laying down fresh straw, preparing for the next caravan seeking shelter for the night. Perched upon a sack of grain, a grizzled stable master trades jokes with passing traders as he efficiently repairs a worn out leather bridle.

node.name: Horse Barn, Inside
node.description: Delightfully fragrant to a horse, the barn's humid air is redolent with the aroma of manure mingled with sweat. Several wooden stalls heaped with fresh, dry straw line this oblong room. Each stall has a feedbag hanging from the back wall, and a stone trough filled with water.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Gulthorn's Hearth Room
node.description: The dining room is one large open hearth. A curved fireback along the far wall leads to a hollow chimney branch. Tall, iron firedogs cradle logs that burn over a bed of embers, in which stand mullers of beer and spiced wine. Gridirons hold sizzling hunks of game while rich stews and savory soups bubble in great, blackened cauldrons. Despite the smoke and heat, the food and the atmosphere here are irresistible, as are the charms of the reserved yet solicitous proprietor, Gulthorn.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Hall Trunk
node.description: The trunk is wide here, showing the intersection of many large limbs. From below you hear the sounds and smell the aromas of good company and good food. Above, you hear only the sighing of leaf laden branches in the wind. Closing off the north branch is a sand colored door, to the south is a marble colored door, and to the west is a grass colored door.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Desert Suite
node.description: In the center of this large circular chamber stands an open-sided tent of fine white gauze. Luxurious, hand woven Neldian rugs are spread beneath it, with bolster pillows scattered about. On a round brass tray beside the tent rest plates of sweetmeats and decanters of rose water. A door painted to resemble fine grained sand leads out.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Mountain Suite
node.description: The tinkling laughter of a mountain stream rushing over rocks to become a waterfall fills the room. This indoor fountain of cleverly painted wood resembles famous Lumerian marble, with cool water cascading down to a pool below. A soft down mattress rests upon a niche in the faux marble, surrounded by heaping baskets full of berries and nuts, and flasks of wild grape wine. A door painted to resemble crystal specked marble leads out.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Savannah Suite
node.description: The walls of this chamber are covered in cool green grasscloth. A magnificent ebonwood carving of a gazelle serves as a frame for a canopied featherbed. Beside it, a table in the shape of an hourglass skin drum holds hollow gourds and wooden trays filled with exotic liqueurs and fruits. A door painted to resemble flowing tall grass leads out.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Treetop Penthouse
node.description: You look out over all of Leth Deriel from this lofty perch. Somehow, you are outside, in the very highest branch of the Rest of Ages Inn, but still, oddly, no outside winds penetrate nor sounds of the forest disturb you. The light takes on a subtle shimmer, as though mediated by some sheltering barrier. In a mighty fork is a great wicker bed, a nest-like affair, but there is little else here that matches your idea of luxury.

node.name: Rest of Ages Inn, Taproot Tavern
node.description: Hollowed out of massive roots, this tavern is homey yet somehow elegant. Intimate tables of rich woods in the shape of large slices of tree trunks are surrounded by plush banquettes. The semi-circular bar is hewn from the tree itself, carefully sculpted into a single piece and covered with glorious depictions of forest life in the golden Elven age. It is low to the ground, and patrons sit on velvet pillows around it conversing with Ulipher, the silver-haired tapster.

node.name: Izma Ru'ef University, Grand Hall
node.description: Inside the hollow trunk of a huge sequoia, nearly as old as Sana'ati Dyaus, is the Grand Hall of Izma Ru'ef University. Along the curved, arching walls are carved bas reliefs in the native wood, scenes of the glory of the Elven Empires of Elanthia. Busts sculpted of precious hardwoods stand on pedestals in a semi-circle along the hall, likenesses of eminent lorethews, Elven and non-Elven, who have taught at the University.

node.name: Izma Ru'ef University, Lecture Hall
node.description: Above the arched roof of the entry is a vast, domed lecture hall. The wood is carved in step-like terraces, to seat large crowds of knowledge-thirsty students. The dome and walls are shaped in such a way as to naturally amplify the sound from the speaker's platform. This hall is also the site of concerts, bardic recitals, dramas and pageants that make up the cycles of life in Leth Deriel.

node.name: Izma Ru'ef University, Library Branch
node.description: The curved walls of the old redwood are carved with deep, high shelves crammed with books, scrolls, all irreplaceable and priceless. One fortunate characteristic of the aromatic wood is that it serves as a natural repellent to bugs, mildew and all the other enemies of paper and parchment. Rough hewn benches and tables topped with flickering oil lamps are occupied by students and professors absorbed in the wonders of the words before their eyes.

node.name: Izma Ru'ef University, Study Branch
node.description: A circular skylight carved into the wooden wall here affords a clear view of the sky above the forest stronghold of Leth Deriel. A small brass telescope on a raised platform points towards the opening. Devices of brass and iron, mechanical models of some sort, sit on some worktables.

node.name: Izma Ru'ef University, Dormitory Branch
node.description: Small wooden doors line the walls, evenly spaced around the circumference of the trunk. These are the student quarters and here live mostly non-Elven exchange students of outstanding ability who have passed the rigorous entrance examinations and interviews required to gain admission into Izma Ru'ef. All Elves, by birthright, are automatically entitled to attend University classes.

node.name: Kazimel's Woodland Spirits, Tasting Room
node.description: Kazimel the Vintner is red-cheeked and looks like he samples his stock more often than mere quality control would dictate. But he is always willing to offer a wee dram to his customers as free samples. Most likely, he enjoys the drinking company. Inside a modest wattle structure are baskets of flavoring agents, herbs like strongly-scented feverfew and vanilla-like dried woodruff, used in making seasonal wines that the Elven palette favors so.

node.name: Kazimel's Woodland Spirits, Wine Cellar
node.description: Amid the oak aging barrels is a formidable contraption, the winepress, with its slatted wooden vats and corkscrew device covers. Traditional Elven wine takes up to two years to mellow in these oak casks. Kazimel's assistants circulate among the containers, racking the wine by drawing off its lees and rotating the stock. Flasks of matured wines sit in racks for additional aging.

node.name: Sinjian's Bardic Requisites, Workshop
node.description: Book-lined shelves and cabinets stand to either side of a large, arched window. Dappled sunlight showers in through its many panes to wash over the cluttered surfaces of polished hardwood sewing tables scattered throughout the room, glinting off of pins and needles scattered amongst the cloth. Finished suits and gowns presented upon mannequins sit at the end of each table, each garment a product of a student's hard work awaiting an admiring Bard.

Silver moonlight spilling in from a large bay window to the north casts deep shadows in the lee of the shelves and cabinets to either side. Only the illumination of a single glass lantern sitting on a long table lightens the enveloping darkness. Sitting there in the pool of golden radiance are several piles of unsewn cloth, awaiting a tailor's touch in the morning.

node.name: Curious Wooden Shed, Abandoned Room
node.description: This shed is deserted, a few oddly shaped glass flasks, vials, and beakers lying shattered on the dirt floor. It appears that the occupant left in a hurry.

node.name: Gymnasium, Entrance
node.description: A statue of Everild stands in the center of the room, with its arms raised to the sky like wings ready for flight. From behind it rolls loud chiming punctuated by staccato drumming. The musky scent of sweat mixed with incense hangs in the air. An archway beyond the sculpture leads deeper into the building.

node.name: Gymnasium, Dance Pit
node.description: Countless bare feet have stomped a hard-packed circle into the dark earthen floor. The air is hazy from burning incense and damp from perspiring bodies. Swan-emblazoned shields hang from one wall, on another rough charcoal drawings depict stick figures in various positions. A pair of ancient Elven barbarians sit in a corner of the sultry room, one thumping a huge kettle drum, the other striking a row of metal chimes with a mallet.

node.name: Gymnasium, Poolside
node.description: Murky water masks the depth of the swimming pool, but a diving board at one end and a Gor'Tog with water to her chin hint that it's safe to jump. A dirty skylight centered over the pool casts a dim glow throughout the room. Some damp towels are thrown haphazardly on the wooden benches lining the walls and a pair of moldy shower shoes lay abandoned in a corner.

node.name: Gymnasium, Meditation Room
node.description: Woven straw mats are scattered around the dimly lit room for those who wish to nourish their inner self. What little light there is filters in through chinks in the walls, illuminating floating motes of dust settling to the floor. A cluttered pile of armor and weapons abruptly snores, proclaiming a person somewhere within.

node.name: Gymnasium, Pool
node.description: Bits of -- something -- floats just below the surface of the turbid water. The jagged walls of the pool gives the impression that this was once a small quarry and a chilly spot in the otherwise tepid water marks where an underground stream feeds into the pool.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, A Path
node.description: A path is barely discernable over the golden-tipped mosses that cover the ground off to the east. The golden-leafed trees thin here and intermix with small, newly-planted fruit trees.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, A Path
node.description: The path is lined with small Halfling-high fruit trees that are covered with both fruit and flowers. Bees lurk within most of the blossoms, quietly gathering their sweet nectar until they zip with a buzz to the next blossom. The slightly sour smell of overly ripe fruit fills the air.
The path is lined with small Halfling-high fruit trees that are covered with both fruit and flowers. The slightly sour smell of overly ripe fruit fills the night air.

node.name: Bosque Deriel, A Path
node.description: The path leads to a clearing and gardens off to the northeast. The forest of trees protects the site, a wild tangle of growth just ever-so-slightly tamed.

node.name: Shrine, A Clearing
node.description: Low-mown sweet grass, chamomile and yarrow carpet this small clearing, centered around a stump of a once-great tree. A nearby plank holds a smoothly polished ram's horn as well as fresh offerings of tarts and ale.

node.name: Shrine, A Vine-Covered Gazebo
node.description: A twisting vine twines about the roof and ceiling joists of this open-air shelter. Heavy blossoms dangle from the vine, swaying gently in the perfume-scented breeze. The wooden planks of the gazebo floor have worn smooth by footsteps, weather and years of polishing with beeswax and care.

node.name: Shrine, A Rose Garden
node.description: The garden is a tumult of tangled blooms, all sweetly scented with rare colors and petal formations. The thorns are very long and sharp, however, protecting the precious blossoms from ravage.

node.name: Shrine, Herb Garden
node.description: A cobblestone walkway surrounds a circular garden, a mass of useful plants divided down the middle with a winding pathway. One section of the garden contains herbs used for medicinal and decorative purposes, the other side full of specimens for poison and known for their bitter properties.

node.name: Fang Cove, Fate's Fortune Lane
node.description: A towering marble archway opens a gap in the wall to the north and separates the ongoing construction and somewhat more refined completed structures of Fate's Fortune Lane from the crude structures and makeshift walkway along the beach. The entrance to a squat, wide bungalow sits in opposition to the arch, and the sheltering cliffs of Fang's Peak rise up from behind it. To either side of the arch, cobblestones of different shapes and sizes have been laid out to form the wide Fate's Fortune Lane.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Entryway
node.description: The scent of ash and soot floats in the air, drifting from the large, rounded structure to the south. Flowered terraces rise on either side of the building's entrance, built in an attempt to cover the air's odor, but the acrid smell of fire and metal easily overpowers the sweetness of the delicate plants. Though no glimpses of flame can be had, an occasional wave of a warm breeze manages to work its way past the dyed leather curtain that hangs across the entryway.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Tool Store
node.description: Surrounding the forge is a rock wall, meticulously arranged from a variety of colored stone in an obvious attempt to compensate for the normally sooty condition of the foundries. Despite the overall state of the well-maintained corral, indelible stains mark its surface, left by uncaring or uncautious workers as they dragged, pushed or pulled their metal projects across the earthen ground and out into the world.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Book Store
node.description: Radically designed for a forge, Iltesh Neg Degti resembles more a stable than a place for serious metal working. Circular in shape, the outer building is predominantly wooden, with a low wall of unburnable stone as a foundation and wide windows to release the heat. Nestled at its heart, however, is a squat granite structure in which all the hottest work takes place.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Maker's Mark Ordering
node.description: The low stone wall that surrounds the entire complex curves toward the south, reminiscent of the serpentine tail of some lazy dragon. Stray grasses and weeds grow up here and there, close enough along the wall to be spared from being trodden by passing boots. Though the roof is high enough to allow the swirling of an occasional breeze, the constant use of the forges keeps the whole area heated to an extreme.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Foundry
node.description: Large indentations in the inner structure of the forge are each home to one or more huge iron crucibles, safely tucked away from heat-stealing drafts. Shovels have been rammed deep into the massive piles of coal along the opposite wall, as though some worker fancied himself a warrior and the coal a foul beast in need of slaying. Colored in similar fashion to the heaps is the bellows, making suitable imaginary wings for the savage, slain monstrosity.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Foundry
node.description: The wind swirls tauntingly a mere stone's throw away, just on the other side of the open frames of the outer wall. Presumably, the gaps were designed to offer some relief from the broiling heat suffered by forge workers, but the necessary safe distance from the blazing fires, the blistering iron crucibles, and the fatigue-draining bellows means that there can be little release from the painful temperatures.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Foundry
node.description: As fitting for a place built by Elven hands, the ironwood timbers bear intricate inscriptions and artistic representations of workers in various stages of effort and relaxation. Since its construction, at least a few of the users of this facility have grown uncaring, as the lower designs vanish beneath piles of coal or are obscured by black dust. Nonetheless, the essence of craftsmanship is evident in everything from the crucible to the bellows, regardless of the forge's rugged functionality.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge Yard
node.description: Unlike the other portions of the forge, the southern-most forge yard is home to regular cool breezes and free from the worst of the heat. Unfortunately, that same cooling wind whips the dust and debris from the grinding rooms against anyone or anything that dares to rest too long. A fine layer of grey and black covers the wall surrounding the complex, a grim testimony that the molten metals and furnace-temperature air are not always the worst hazards in a forge.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge Yard
node.description: Judging by the marks in the dirt, many have made use of the ample space available in the forge yard to work on large projects, leaving behind only hoof prints and the deep scars of the horses' dragged burdens. In emergency situations, this area likely has served as additional room to house troops or repair arms and armor, but for now, it sits unused. Only the dust from the grinding rooms sweeps through the area on any regular basis.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge Yard
node.description: Left to rust in the one section of the forge open to the sky, several scrap metal bits of incomprehensible design lean against the wooden slats of the outer wall. Some are combinations of basic geometric shapes, while others seem to be nothing more than large hunks of slag. Here they lie, exposed to the ravages of wind and rain, ignoring the blatant sign proclaiming that all workers should dispose of unwanted materials appropriately.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Grinding Area
node.description: Unmistakably in a favorite location, the grindstone here has been kept routinely cleaned, revealing its white stone surface. The reason for the preference is obvious with every breath. Though the stifling heat that plagues the other areas of the forge is not absent here, a gentle draft manages to pull most of the aberrant dust out into the forge yard and away from panting workers slaving over the grindstone.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge Supply Shop
node.description: All along the eaves, reed wind chimes and ornamental decorations jangle and dance, bouncing gently off one another. With every breeze, the soft clinks and jingles of the noisemakers rise in subtle crescendo, playing counterpoint with the steady pounding of hammer on steel in other sections of the forge.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge
node.description: Resembling little more than extravagant walk-in chimneys, the smithies of Leth Deriel's renowned forge works are smartly crafted with fluted stones to direct smoke and ash upward. Though free of smoky obstruction, the air is still hot enough to induce instant beads of sweat on exposed flesh. Presumably, the vents near the roof that release the gaseous by-products of heated metal and burning wood are too far above to make for an equal respite from temperature.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge
node.description: A constant sibilant sound of hissing stirs the chamber, augmented in orchestral fashion by the odd low pops of heat and the high-pitched whistle of outside breezes. Grey streamers of smoke flutter upward from a reinforced forge, ascending like a pack of drab butterflies to freedom through the vents in the roof.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Forge
node.description: Arranged neatly in this cramped area is a good assortment of the tools of the trade. A steel anvil awaits every new blow of the hammer, its horn polished by either a tidy hand or regular use. Standing half the height of the chimney-like room, a stone forge melds flawlessly with the back wall. Lines of soot and dust trail upward in little spirals along the wall, the only remains of the smoke and ash from the forge's previous use.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Grinding Area
node.description: Beneath the cover of the high, sloped roof, the grindstones have been used for years, spouting layer upon layer of dust in a triangular spray against the walls and ground. Often, a miscreant burst of wind will suck away some of residue, sending it into the forge yard as short swirls of choking filth. Luckily, the area is not left just for the wind to clean, and the ground is scraped by the marks of shovel and broom.

node.name: Iltesh Neg Degti, Grinding Area
node.description: The sounds of work in the other sections of the forge echo through the walls of this area, reverberating even over the noisy spinning of grindstones. Since this space is bordered on two sides by stone walls -- one being the back of the forge area -- the ringing tones of metal on metal bounce noisily, clashing with the rasping grindstones, and creating a distorted cacophony of sound.

node.name: Sana'ati Dyaus, Carousel Booth
node.description: A carved ivory lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, brightly-tapestried room, flanking a silversteel door to the north.

node.name: Sana'ati Dyaus, Item Regstration Office
node.description: Green and white marble tiles cover the floor in a crisscrossing pattern. Two brass lanterns hang on the wall behind a low counter. Stacks of papers cover the tops of a row of cabinets, waiting to be filed away.

node.name: Sana'ati Dyaus, Registrar's Office
node.description: Elegant dark oak cabinets with polished brass hardware line the wall behind a stately maple desk. A tall brass lantern sits in each corner of the room, providing ample light to do business.

node.name: Sana'ati Dyaus, Carousel Family Services
node.description: A series of guarded arches line the southern wall. The complicated framework of iron and timbers spans across the ceiling. Countless gears, pulleys and weights form the strikingly complex mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: Dira'ela Lloriena's Beauty Salon
node.description: Ornate statuary, brilliant emerald and maroon satin curtains, and several golden-gilded floor-to-ceiling mirrors testify to Lady Lloriena's motto too much is never enough. Half a dozen elaborately carved chairs, plush with thick, embroidered pillows stand before each of the enormous oval mirrors, ready to seat customers.

node.name: Sana'ati Dyaus, Rundmolen Post Office
node.description: Tucked up against the conic building is a low stone counter made from green and white marble. Potted plants ring the area, their lush foliage sectioning off the area from the bustling square beyond. Vast, countless rows of differently sized shelves are behind the counter, and complex Dwarven mechanisms can be heard as they rearrange the package-covered storage. Clerks shuffle endlessly back and forth between the counters and shelving as they assist patrons with their packaging and mailing needs.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Pathway
node.description: The sounds of Bosque Deriel and Leth Deriel further on are muted by the suddenly dense woods. The brush-choked pathway makes its way further east, eventually opening up into a wide clearing. Wooden bridges link some of the trees here, likely for the town's scouting guardsmen and hunters alike. Crates of tools and supplies are nestled amongst the creeping vines and other undergrowth of the forest.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Gathering Pit
node.description: From time to time, the sounds of a team of woodsmen can be heard as they carefully choose and fell another of the forest's elder trees. The pruning serves dual purposes -- to supply the needs of nearby Leth Deriel as well as to renew the woods with younger, stouter growth. The small clearing here allows travelers and workers alike a brief respite from the day's duties while the stone-encircled firepit provides food, light, and warmth during the colder months.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Old Growth
node.description: Elder trees, some native and others clearly transported, dot the clearing at irregular intervals. A mix of trees including spruce, pines, oaks and more are evident, as well as stumps of other, now unidentifiable ones. An abundance of wildlife including raccoons, rabbits, birds, wolves and more are frequently seen or heard moving through without care for the woodsmen nearby.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Old Growth
node.description: A handful of cabins, each constructed from wood found nearby, provide shelter for those of the small encampment. The trees encircling the broader clearing draw up against the backs of these dwellings, their intertwined canopies draping protectively over the roofs. As the breeze shifts, both smells and smoke periodically fill the air from the nearby firepit.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Old Growth
node.description: Melodies that would make even members of the Bards' Guild jealous rise and fall in intensity, pacing, and volume as birds of all shapes, sizes and colors fill the clearing with their songs. The cabins nearby blend into the trees along the edges of the small outpost. Covered with creeping vines and flowering plants that weave throughout them, the foliage provides ample nesting space for the varied species bringing life to the space.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Old Growth
node.description: Aimlessly in trios and pairs, dragonflies of shimmering opalescent rainbow colors hover and dart from one lichen-covered trunk to the next in an endless dance. Up above, a series of simple rope and wood bridges weave amongst the nearby trees and disappear into the denser woods beyond the clearing. From time to time, the smells of charring meat accompany the sizzling sounds of a meal being prepared via the firepit at the heart of the clearing.

node.name: Forest Clearing, Rocky Mound
node.description: In this small corner of the clearing, a giant mound of boulders and rocks dominates the setting. A majestic weave of different vines has been coaxed into covering most to soften their surfaces. The weaving doesn't appear entirely natural, even for delicate Elven hands, but rather as if enhanced by a Nature Binder's skilled magical training. One of the flat, rocky surfaces was left exposed, and small tools and trinkets are frequently left for others in need.
